alfredsnippet.snippet:
"A person who challenges the conventional wisdom is likely first to be ignored, then dismissed, and finally, if these responses are inadequate, attacked. When an outsider sends a paper to established scientists, for example, many will not bother to reply. When an entire dissident field establishes its own publications, it may be ignored by the mainstream."

- Strategies for Dissenting Scientists, Brian Martin, Science and Technology Studies, University of Wollongong, NSW 2522, Australia
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - How the Mainstrem Reacts to Challenges
